content:
Unfortunately, I have no idea at all what the gmail recovery tool is. But with a bit of googling I guess you mean this https://support.google.com/mail/workflow/9317561?hl=en

You may have used Thunderbird with Gmail for an extended time, but you obviously missed the fact Gmail is different. You have no inbox folder on gmail. You have no folders at all. You have an all mail message store and some messages have a label for inbox, some others might have a label for "important" and some might have both. This extends to all the thinks you call folders. See the Thunderbird user support document for details https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail#w_gmails-particularities

When Gmail makes mail available via IMAP. Google simulate folders on the fly based on the labels assigned to individual emails. Google offer some fairly extensive controls on what labels are offered as IMAP folders. See https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/labels

There is one constant that has existed for as long as gmail has existed. All mail is in the all mail folder and some of the all mail contents may have an inbox label. Others might have a trash/bin/Deleted label

The fact that they are all appearing as unread new messages in the inbox is almost certainly caused by your recovery activity. You do not mention what changes or otherwise you have made to Thunderbird, or what happened to necessitate a full recovery of the last 30 days deletions which probably resets all mail to a new unread state. How you are interacting with Gmail within Thunderbird is really an unknown as you have not shared your settings for the account But you might want to visit this google page and ensure you have the defaults selected for your IMAP folders. https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/fwdandpop



.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Supported versions of Thunderbird start at version 128 especially with the new monthly release schedule seeing the current release version being version 137.

Then we also appear to be having issues with semantics. Thunderbird has no message preview. It has a reading pane, which I assume you are referring to as a preview pane. It is in no way functionally different to having the email open in a tab or it's own window. The only reason I split that hair is because there are those out there (They have instructed me in this forum on the security advantages) that think viewing stuff in the "preview" is somehow safer and it is not.

So have you tried using the "customize" option on the more menu?

Or have you perhaps been using the compact header addon https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/compact-headers/?src=search
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
zemran said
How can I delete duff XMPP accounts?

The same way you delete any surplus accounts or any kind. You go into account settings tab. Select the account and use the account actions button at the bottom of the list to remove it.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
What you say is correct, the process ceases once an error occurs. That is how it works as Thunderbird is a mail client not a file system, resilience against errors was not something the original developers had much need for almost 30 years ago.

The import export tools will export mail to local storage and import it again into a local folder (still local storage). Or individual EML files which have I would guess have their headers parsed in the export process. It does not work with IMAP folders is my experience. But you are talking about IMAP errors generated by a third party product you are paying for in "proton mail" Have you raised your issue with them?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt said
Or individual EML files which have I would guess have their headers parsed in the export process.

I get these errors when I export it as EML files as well, but as I mentioned earlier, the import doesn't stop.

Matt said
It does not work with IMAP folders is my experience. But you are talking about IMAP errors generated by a third party product you are paying for in "proton mail" Have you raised your issue with them?

The transfer works for IMAP folders, but there is something that isn't acceptable by my IMAP provider - Proton. They wanted a copy of the message that is generating this error, but I have no idea which one it is since the imported ones appear in no particular order.

content:
What is more important is does the email actually have an attachment? I have seen all sorts of erroneous paperclips in the user interface over the years. Usually related to encrypted mail, signature ans in some cases calendars entries.

You are asking for someone to guess. We have no access to either your machine or your emails. So really with the dearth of information supplied in your initial post not much extra can be said.
